name: udemy_bulk_search
description: Search multiple topics on Udemy in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling udemy_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string.

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="course-card"], [data-purpose="course-card-container"]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('h3, [class*="title"]'); const instructorEl = el.querySelector('[class*="instructor"]'); const ratingEl = el.querySelector('[class*="rating"] span'); const priceEl = el.querySelector('[class*="price"] span'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="/course/"]'); results.push({ name: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', instructor: instructorEl ? instructorEl.textContent.trim() : '', rating: ratingEl ? ratingEl.textContent.trim() : '', price: priceEl ? priceEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('q') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
